html:
** iPhone maker's shares AAPL.O down 0.3% at $160.5 premarket, while e-commerce giant's shares AMZN.O ticks 0.3% lower to $3,561.79

** Italy's antitrust authority fines U.S. tech giants AMZN and AAPL a total of more than 200 mln euros ($225 mln) for alleged anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products (Full Story)

** Watchdog says a 2018 agreement between the cos meant only some resellers were allowed to sell Apple and Beats products on AMZN's Italian website

** Both cos say they plan to appeal against the fines

** As of last close, AAPL has risen ~21% this year, while AMZN has added ~10%


(Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
